comments:
After creating a Jar using the JAR Packager I got the dialog "finished with
warnings" telling me that I should "see details for additional information".

After expanding the dialog using the Details button there is a long list of
entries reading "JAR export finished ... see details for additional information."

In addition I seem to get a StackOverflow when I try to copy one of these
entries using the context-menu

Which build?

Steps to reproduce?

>"JAR export finished ... see details for additional information."
Please you provide the full message.

>In addition I seem to get a StackOverflow when I try to copy one of these
>entries using the context-menu
Check the .log for details.

Original entry was based on I200405051045, but the same thing happens on
I200405060200. 

Steps to reproduce: 

- create a new java project
- create a new java class in this project
  for example: 
public class Foo1 {
    private int i;
}
- enable the compiler warning "unused or unread private member"
- try to export this project as a jar file (no special settings needed, just
enter the name of a jar-file and press "finish".

For example 3.0M7 produces a message "jar export finished with warnings. see
details for additional information". If you click on details you will get the
message "Exported with compile warnings: /foo/Foo1.java".

Now (don't remember with which build that one last worked for me) with build
I200405060200 I get the same dialog (jar export finished with warnings. see
details ...", but if I click on details, the detail-area just contains the same
message again (see attached screen-shot)

No .log entries other than

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at java.util.Date.parse(Date.java:582)
	at java.util.Date.<init>(Date.java:264)
	at
org.eclipse.update.internal.configurator.ConfigurationParser.processConfig(ConfigurationParser.java:277)

but these occur before starting the jar exporter.

Regarding the last sentence - if I try to use "copy" in the context menu of the
details area I get the following in the log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Mai 07, 2004 22:30:41.125
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Mai 07, 2004 22:30:41.125
!MESSAGE java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError


Regarding the last sent

I think the problem is in org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.ErrorDialog in the method
void populateList(List listToPopulate, IStatus buildingStatus, int nesting). 

I think in the line sb.append(status.getMessage()); the buildingStatus passed to
the method should be used instead of the status.

I think a similar bug is in the method void populateCopyBuffer(IStatus
buildingStatus, StringBuffer buffer, int nesting), where instead of "IStatus[]
children = status.getChildren();" "IStatus[] children =
buildingStatus.getChildren();" should be used. Looks like a good cause for a
stack overflow.

What I mentioned in Comment 5 is already fixed in CVS HEAD.

With these changes this does work again.
